p: The seeds, root, and bark extract of M. ferruginea darasana were evaluated for in-vitro toxicity against Amblyomma variegatum Fabricius larvae (both male and female) at a different concentration ranging from 20 to 100% in Petri plates. Based on the mortality rate, it was observed that no toxic constituents were present in leaves extract where, the highest toxicity is observed in seed followed by root extract ( Choudhury et al., 2015).
